marklogic.body:
Oven FRIED? That's a new one on me. And I make my fried chicken like my grandma did. You season the outside, roll the pieces in flour, and fry them on medium Heat, in canola oil, or olive oil, or peanut oil. Turn the pieces often so that no side gets too brown. When all are evenly fried, drain each one. And put into a baking dish, like Pyrex. Cover with foil, tighten the sides, and bake at 350f for 1 hour. And serve. You can also poach chicken for falling Off the bone tender- ness. Just fry as above,remove chicken parts,drain the oil, add a can of chicken broth, return chicken to pan, and cover with a lid and bring to a boil. Lower Heat to just simmer, and let it cook for about a half hour, turning a couple of times to baste the chicken pieces. You will have very tender, tasty chicken (in pieces), that's finger licking good.
Either way is delicious. Bon Appetit!
